page.title: 10LOWER REDBROOK: CHANGES
page.content: Today the only public transport is by {bus,}a return service from{Monmouth}to {Chepstow.}On Tuesdays there is a free bus from{Redbrook}to{Carrefour Hyper- {market}and back.In 1945 the{Red and {White}bus company ran services between {Monmouth}and{Chepstow,}and the{Bristol {Omnibus Co.}between{Coleford}and { {Monmouth,}via{Redbrook.}Trains ran from{Monmouth}to {Chepstow,}stopping at{Redbrook Railway Station.}The trains carried freight as well as passengers, including coal and iron for the tinplate works.The line is now dismantled and the station knocked down. The school caretaker's garden is where the station was and you can walk where the line was. There were fewer car owners than today and less vehicles on the road. People could cross the river by{ferry-boat}but now the only crossing is by{footbridge. }
